entry.name: load
entry.title: .load()
entry.desc: Bind an event handler to the "load" event, or trigger that event on an element.

argument.name: handler
argument.desc: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

argument.name: eventData
argument.desc: An object containing data that will be passed to the event handler.

argument.name: handler
argument.desc: A function to execute each time the event is triggered.

div.p: This API has been removed in jQuery 3.0.
Instead of .load( handler ) or .load( eventData, handler ), use .on( "load", handler ) or .on( "load", eventData, handler ), respectively.
The Ajax module also has a method named .load(). Which one is fired depends on the set of arguments passed.
